icontrol.drivers.instruments.lakeshore

Class LakeshoreTC

  • java.lang.Object
    • icontrol.drivers.Device
      • icontrol.drivers.instruments.lakeshore.LakeshoreTC
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Lakeshore332, Lakeshore340

    @iC_Annotation(CommPorts=GPIB)
public class LakeshoreTC
extends Device
    Generic Temperature Controller class for Lakeshore temperature controllers based on a Lakeshore 331 model.

    Usage: Derived classes should override the default constructor to initialize the Instrument specific parameters, such as the maximum number of Heater Ranges appropriately.

    Unfortunately, there seems to be no way the Annotations can contain variables, hence, if a derived class is not happy with the provided annotations, the method in question can be overridden and supplied with a proper annotation, and by calling the super class' method save to duplicate the method body.

    Note: Tests showed that the set point temperature is not changed when the command is sent directly after changing the ramp rate on a Lakeshore 332. (see Change Log 110919 for details). No error was generated. This was confirmed by sending RAMP 2,0,10.000\n\rSETP 2, 70 using NI Measurement and Automation Explorer. Adding a 100ms delay after setting the ramp rate helped. Some other commands also wait for 100 ms before exiting. All device commands that the generic Lakeshore temperature controller understands are implemented here.

    Instrument Commands:

    • configDefaults(String, int)
    • configInputCurve(java.lang.String, int)
    • #enableHeaterOuput(boolean)
    • getTemp(String)
    • monitorTemp(String, float, String)
    • #setHeaterRange(int)
    • setRampRate(int, boolean, double)
    • setTemp(int, float, boolean, float, float)
    Version:
    0.3
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)

    • Field Detail

      • m_DefaultInputChannel

        protected java.lang.String m_DefaultInputChannel
        Stores the default Input Channel. Initialized with a non-valid String to indicate that the default Input Channel has yet to be assigned.

      • m_DefaultLoop

        protected int m_DefaultLoop
        Stores the default loop#. Initialized with -1 to indicate that the default channel has not yet been assigned.

      • m_AvailableLoops

        protected java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> m_AvailableLoops
        Defines the available loop numbers for this temperature controller. The list must contain the loop number 0 used to address the default loop. If a derived class supports an Instrument with more Loops, this variable should be updated in the derived class' constructor.

      • m_AvailableInputChannels

        protected java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> m_AvailableInputChannels
        Defines the available input channels for this temperature controller. The list must contain the input channel 'default' to address the default input channel. Note that the channel designation specified in m_AvailableInputChannels must be in upper case letters; this does not influence the case insensitivity in the Script. If a derived class supports an Instrument with more Input Channels, this variable should be updated in the derived class' constructor (see Lakeshore340 for an example.

      • PRECISION

        protected final java.lang.String PRECISION
        Defines the String used in String.format to append certain values (for instance the temperature) to be sent via GPIB bus. If derived classes are not allowed to change this constant, the 'final' restriction might be lifted.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • m_MaxInputCurveNumber

        protected int m_MaxInputCurveNumber
        Defines the largest Input-Curve-Number

      • m_MaxHeaterRange

        protected int m_MaxHeaterRange
        Defines the maximum heater range for this temperature controller

      • m_LastHeaterRange

        private int m_LastHeaterRange
        Store last Heater Range if Heater is switched off with setHeaterOutput

      • m_Logger

        private static final java.util.logging.Logger m_Logger
        The Logger for this class. Note that the Logger Level is set in the constructor of the Device class.

      • m_DefaultWaitTime

        private int m_DefaultWaitTime
        Default wait time after setting certain parameters in the Lakeshore

    • Constructor Detail

      • LakeshoreTC

        public LakeshoreTC()
        Default constructor. Initializes the parameter range for this temperature controller, such as maximum heater range, maximum input curve number, etc.

        Derived classes should copy this constructor and initialize the variables according to the Instrument's capabilities. They also need to invoke this constructor (for creation of the HashSets).

        Note: If this constructor is updated, the constructor of derived classes should also be updated!

    • Method Detail

      • checkLoop

        protected int checkLoop(int Loop)
                 throws java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Performs a Syntax-Check for the correct Control Loop number and assigns the chosen default Control Loop if necessary.
        Parameters:
        Loop - The Loop number to check; 0 stands for the default loop
        Returns:
        The corrected Loop number; might be the same as Loop or it is the default Loop number. In any case, it is guaranteed a valid Loop number.
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - If Syntax-Check failed.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The corrected Input Channel; might be the same as InputChannel or it is the default Input Channel. In any case, it is guaranteed a valid Input Channel.

      • configDefaults

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Configure the default Input Channel and the default Control Loop.",
                   ParameterNames={"Input Channel {default, A, B, (C, ...)}","Loop# {0, 1, 2, (3, ...)}"},
                   DefaultValues={"A","1"},
                   ToolTips={"<html>\'default\': addresses the Input Channel previously defined in \'configDefaults\'<br>\'A\', \'B\', ...: the Input Channel as displayed on the Instrument<br>The number of available Input Channels depends on the Instrument.</html>","<html>\'0\': addresses the Control Loop previously defined in \'configDefaults\'<br>\'1\', \'2\', ...: the Control Loop as displayed on the Instrument<br>The number of available Loops depends on the Instrument.</html>"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)

        Loop - The Loop number to be used as the default loop#.

      • setTemp

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Sets the SetPoint temperature.",
                   ParameterNames={"Loop# {0,1,2,(3,...)}","Temperature [unit of SetPoint]","Wait until SP reached?","Temperature Tolerance [K]","Stabilization Time [s]"},
                   DefaultValues={"0","295","false","0.1","10"},
                   ToolTips={"<html>\'0\': addresses the Control Loop previously defined in \'configDefaults\'<br>\'1\', \'2\': the Control Loop as displayed on the Instrument<br>The number of available Loops depends on the Instrument.</html>","The unit is the same as for the SetPoint (as displayed on the Temperature Controller).","When selected, this method waits until the temperature is within a small tolerance band of the set point.","The allowed temperature variation for the command to continue","The time during which the temperature toleracne is checked before continuing processing the script"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void setTemp(int Loop,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  float Temperature,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  boolean Wait,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  float Tolerance,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  float Time)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  javax.script.ScriptException
        Sets the SetPoint temperature in units of the setpoint. If Wait

        is set to false, this method returns immediately, if set to true, the temperature needs to be within Tolerance for the duration Time before the method returns. The channel used to measure the temperature in case Wait

        is set to true is queried from the instrument using the CSET? command. This method performs a (crude) Syntax Check.

        Parameters:
        Loop - The number of the loop to change the setpoint. Allowed values are defined in m_AvailableLoops.
        Temperature - The new SetPoint temperature in units of the SetPoint.
        Wait - If set to false the method returns immediately, if set to true, the temperature must be stable before the method returns
        Tolerance - Specify the maximum allowed temperature variation in Kelvin to qualify for a stable temperature
        Time - The time in seconds the temperature must be within the tolerance in order for the temperature to be stable
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax check fails
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from SendToInstrument
        javax.script.ScriptException

      • autoSetPoint

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Disables Ramping, set the Set Point to the current Temperature,<br>and re-sets Ramping to the previous setting.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"Input Channel {default, A, B, (C, ...)}","Loop# {0,1,2,(3,...)}"},
                   DefaultValues={"default","0"},
                   ToolTips={"<html>\'default\': addresses the input channel previously defined in \'configDefaults\'<br>\'A\', \'B\', ...: the Input Channels as displayed on the Instrument<br>The number of available Input Channels depends on the Instrument.</html>","<html>\'0\': addresses the Control Loop previously defined in \'configDefaults\'<br>\'1\', \'2\': the Control Loop as displayed on the Instrument<br>The number of available Loops depends on the Instrument.</html>"})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void autoSetPoint(java.lang.String InputChannel,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     int Loop)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     javax.script.ScriptException
        Sets the SetPoint to the current temperature by temporarily disabling ramping. The previous Ramp settings are restored..

        This method performs a (crude) Syntax Check.

        Parameters:
        InputChannel - for which the temperature should be read (defined in m_AvailableInputchannels)
        Loop - The number of the loop to change the setpoint. Allowed values are defined in m_AvailableLoops.
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax check fails
        java.io.IOException - re-thrown from SendToInstrument
        javax.script.ScriptException

      • configInputCurve

                   DefaultValues={"A","21"},
                   ToolTips={"",""})

public void configInputCurve(java.lang.String InputChannel,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              int CurveNumber)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       throws java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              java.io.IOException
        Set the Input-Curve-Number for the specified Input Channel (see manual page 9-33).

        This method performs a SyntaxCheck.

        Parameters:
        InputChannel - Selects the input channel for the loop; can be 'A' or 'B'.
        CurveNumber - Selects the Input Curve Number. Must be within [0...60].
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax check fails
        java.io.IOException - when GPIB communication fails (bubbles up from SendToInstrument.

      • getTemp

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Reads the Temperature of the given input channel.</html>",
                   ParameterNames="Input Channel {default, A, B, (C, ...)}",
                   ToolTips="<html>\'default\': addresses the input channel previously defined in \'configDefaults\'<br>\'A\', \'B\', ...: the Input Channels as displayed on the Instrument<br>The number of available Input Channels depends on the Instrument.</html>",
                   DefaultValues="default")
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public float getTemp(java.lang.String InputChannel)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          javax.script.ScriptException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Returns the temperature in Kelvin from the specified Input Channel (A, B, ...) or the default Input Channel defined in configDefaults. This method performs a Syntax-Check. This method also checks if the retrieved temperature reading is valid by querying RDGST? (see page 9-41) and returns Float.NaN for invalid readings. Note that a bug in current Lakeshore's firmware, the status is reported as okay even if no input curve was selected.
        Parameters:
        InputChannel - for which the temperature should be read (defined in m_AvailableInputchannels)
        Returns:
        The Temperature in Kelvin from the chosen Input Channel, or -1.1+0.1*random() if in No-Communication-Mode. Tho return a (unphysical) temperature is helpful to test the rest of the program. If the instrument returned an invalid reading, the returned value is set to Float.NaN
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown by QueryInstrument
        javax.script.ScriptException - thrown by getFloat if the Instrument's response could not be converted into a float
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - if Syntax-Check failed

      • getTempSU

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Reads the Temperature of the given input channel in Sensor Units.</html>",
                   ParameterNames="Input Channel {default, A, B, (C, ...)}",
                   ToolTips="<html>\'default\': addresses the input channel previously defined in \'configDefaults\'<br>\'A\', \'B\', ...: the Input Channels as displayed on the Instrument<br>The number of available Input Channels depends on the Instrument.</html>",
                   DefaultValues="default")
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public float getTempSU(java.lang.String InputChannel)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            javax.script.ScriptException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Returns the temperature in Sensor Units from the specified Input Channel (A, B, ...) or the default Input Channel defined in configDefaults. This method performs a Syntax-Check.
        Parameters:
        InputChannel - for which the temperature should be read (defined in m_AvailableInputchannels)
        Returns:
        The Temperature in Sensor Units from the chosen Input Channel, or -1.1+0.1*random() if in No-Communication-Mode. Tho return a (unphysical) temperature is helpful to test the rest of the program. If the instrument returned an invalid reading, the returned value is set to Float.NaN
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown by QueryInstrument
        javax.script.ScriptException - thrown by getFloat if the Instrument's response could not be converted into a float
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - if Syntax-Check failed

      • setRampRate

        @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="Sets the ramp rate and enables/disables ramping.",
                   ParameterNames={"Loop# {0, 1, 2, (3, ...)}","On/Off","Ramp Rate [K/min]"},
                   DefaultValues={"0","true","10"},
                   ToolTips={"<html>\'0\': addresses the Control Loop previously defined in \'configDefaults\'<br>\'1\', \'2\', ...: the Control Loop as displayed on the Instrument<br>The number of available Loops depends on the Instrument.</html>","",""})
 @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
public void setRampRate(int Loop,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              boolean OnOff,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              double RampRate)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       throws java.util.zip.DataFormatException,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              java.io.IOException
        Set the Ramp rate and allows to enable/disable ramping. This method performs a SyntaxCheck.
        Parameters:
        Loop - The number of the loop to change the ramp rate. Can be 1 or 2.
        OnOff - When true, ramping is enabled.
        RampRate - The ramp rate in K/minutes
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax check fails
        java.io.IOException - when GPIB communication fails (bubbles up from SendToInstrument.

      • monitorTemp

        @iC_Annotation(MethodChecksSyntax=true)
 @AutoGUIAnnotation(DescriptionForUser="<html>Monitors the temperature at the given intervall<br>Stores the temperatures in a file with the given extension.</html>",
                   ParameterNames={"Input channel {A or B}","Time Intervall [sec]","File Extension"},
                   DefaultValues={"A","1"},
                   ToolTips={"","Time between two measurements.","If the FileExtension does not contain a \'.\' a \'.\' is automatically added."})
public void monitorTemp(java.lang.String InputChannel,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           float TimeIntervall,
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           java.lang.String FileExtension)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    throws java.util.zip.DataFormatException
        Starts a new thread that reads the temperature of the given input channel at the given time interval and stores it in a file together with the number of seconds elapsed since processing of the script started.

        This methods performs a crude syntax check, hence it is called during Syntax-Check mode, and needs to return without IO communication if it was successful.

        Parameters:
        InputChannel - The temperature of this input channel is monitored; can be "A" or "B".
        TimeIntervall - The temperature is monitored every TimeInterval-seconds.
        FileExtension - is appended to the FileName used to store the monitored temperatures. If it contains no '.' a '.' is automatically inserted. If the filename already exists, a new file with a counter is inserted between the FileName and the FileExtension.
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.DataFormatException - when the Syntax Check failed.

      • DefaultWait

        private void DefaultWait()
        Waits the default time period (100 ms) before it returns. It appears advisable to call this method each time some parameter is set on an (older?) Lakeshore controller.

        From the Change Log 110919: Apparently the set point temperature is not changed when the command is sent directly after changing the ramp rate on a Lakeshore 332. No error was generated. This was confirmed by sending RAMP 2,0,10.000\n\rSETP 2, 70 using NI Measurement and Automation Explorer.

        Note: When checking completion of CRVSAV in Lakeshore340.UpdateSensorCurve I tried to use *ESE 1, *SRE 32, *OPC? and *STB? respectively *ESR? to check for completion. Now I use BUSY? instead, but sending the *OPC command might be useful in DefaultWait.
